articles.title: Reproducible science workshop
articles.contents:
Who: Olivier Gimenez
When: March 18, 2021
Where: Zoom
Timeline
Motivations (20 minutes)
Manipulating data in the tidyverse (80 minutes)
Visualising data in the tidyverse (80 minutes)
Lunch break (90 minutes)
Writing dynamic and reproducible documents with R Markdown (60 minutes)
Versioning with Git and GitHub in RStudio (60 minutes)
Take-home messages (30 minutes)
Requirements
Download and install Git.
You will need a GitHub account, you can easily set up a free account here.
Install R and RStudio
Have Git, GitHub and RStudio talk to each other following these guidelines (section 2.2.2 Configuration only).
Install the following R packages: tidyverse, sf, emo, janitor, palmerpenguins, usethis and lubridate. You can install them all at once by running the following code in the R command line:


install.packages(c("tidyverse", "sf", "emo", "janitor", "palmerpenguins", "usethis", "lubridate"))



Corrections
If you see mistakes or want to suggest changes, please create an issue on the source repository.
